nodes.bodyText: This class can extend AbstractTestClass and you could use one of its ZKs instantiated in that class.

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't it be something like "ZK_PATH_SHARDING_KEYS" instead of "addresses"? Also, let's make "ZK_PATH_SHARDING_KEYS" a constant.
I was under the impression that we'll change the ZNRecord, so I didn't think too hard about it. You're right that the key name should represent "sharding keys" in a way.

There could be a few cases where you might have to validate the status of the routing data in the metadata store.

Do we have the ROUTING_DATA_PATH path set?
Do we have any metadata stores registered under that path?
What if there are no keys registered?

Let's alert the user appropriately for each scenario - by adding sanity checks.
Per discussion, added exception throwing behavior in 4 different cases.
Note that this will be implementing IZKDataListener, IZkChildListener, and IZkStateChangeListener interfaces in other PRs.

nodes.bodyText: InvalidRoutingDataException is used with MetadataStoreRoutingDataAccessor interface. We want to keep it generic as this exception can be used by other implementations of the accessor.

nodes.bodyText: Do you see any potentials to use these constants in other classes? If yes, shall we have a separate class as ZKRoutingConstant or something to hold these constants?
+1. We could create a constant class.

I don't think other classes will use these constants. The first one ROUTING_DATA_PATH is used by zookeeper accessor only, and it wouldn't make sense for other classes to use it. The second one is most likely used by this class only, as well.
What's the reason for these two different scenario? I think shardingKeys list handled by us, right? Do you see the case of shardingKeys is empty?
The data in ZooKeeper is actually managed by the users, so guarding is necessary. Whether there should be two different scenarios for this, I'm fine either way.

Let's use:
"Routing data directory " + ROUTING_DATA_PATH + " does not exist! Routing ZooKeeper: " + zkAddress
Makes sense.

What about namespaces?
"There are no namespaces found in this routing ZooKeeper! Routing ZooKeeper: " + zkAddress
When you say namespaces, are you suggesting that there should be one more ZNode level above ROUTING_DATA_PATH? If so that's not my impression to the design. Could you elaborate?
These two cases could probably be merged.
Separating them does provide more information on why the routing data is invalid, but I don't have a strong preference on either choices.
Merging.
It'd be a good idea to add a schematic so that the reviewers/readers could understand this better.
As in comments? Sure.
Use the constant instead.
Declare using the interface, initialize using the implementation.
Declare using the interface, initialize using the implementation.
Declare using the interface, initialize using the implementation.
Can we avoid importing *? The file helix-style-intellij.xml should help you format the imports.
This was an automatic line generated. Let me change it.

You don't have to use exits to check this path as it would add one more unnecessary read request to ZK. getChildren will give you ZkNoNodeException if the path does not exit. So just catch the ZkNoNodeException and save one READ request to ZK.
Makes sense. Changing.
Nit, maybe you can give it a clearer name like routingData, instead of this vague one?
Good point
Fix style

Instead of calling it children, let's give a more meaningful message:

There are no metadata store realms defined in the routing zookeeper: " + zkAddress?
nit: is null check necessary on children (might not be. ignore if not)?
Nit: let's call it ZNode, instead of node
Can you make this a private variable and reuse it? Create a @beforeClass. Also create a @afterclass method and close all ZK connections/other connected resources (such as base data accessor)
Let's add a close() method.
